data.title: great food! Pizzas are yummy!
data.text: Toscani is a great place for pizza and even sausage rolls!  They have good prices on their food too. It is downtown among many businesses.

data.title: Early dinner
data.text: I finished my business early and stopped by Toscani Pizzeria for an early dinner. The food was good, the service was excellent and the portions were big.

data.title: Great food...Excellent prices!
data.text: This place was recommended to me by a friend. Ended up eating there 4 times for lunch. First time there I had the Spring Salad. Excellent. Salad came in 3 sizes half and full. On next visit I tried their Pizza for one. Price was reasonable. You got a 1 topping and paid for extra toppings. On last visit I tried the shrimp linguine with bread sticks. Absolutely delicious. Had so much that I took half of it back to hotel to eat later. Prices were fabulous. Would highly recommend this "little hole in the wall!"

data.title: Great food. Cozy restaurant.
data.text: Been here a couple times the pizza was good but the sausage rolls were incredible we had. Some of the best in the Fort. Just the right amount of seasoning. Not spicy.  Lots of flavor, even after freezing it and reheating it in the oven three days later, still holds its flavor! We didn't get any BBQ sauce with our carry out order. Highly recommend this place. One sausage roll is probably big enough for or two. Unless you can eat a pound or two of food. They're huge!

data.title: Good quality Italian restaurant
data.text: The food here was very good, and the atmosphere was more upscale than a basic pizza restaurant. Service was very slow, with too few employees (few patrons, too). The restaurant had the air conditioning cranked, so bring a layer of clothing, even if it's really hot. This place was a little pricier than most pizza places, but better quality, too. The pizza is thick dough with lots of cheese. Not healthy, but tasty.

data.title: Great downtown lunch option
data.text: Did you ever have one of those dishes from a restaurant that you get cravings for? For me, Toscani's baked ham and cheese sandwich is one of those dishes. It's the sauce. And the bread. And the shredded cabbage and lettuce combo. I get hungry for it every month or so. On my recent lunch-time visit, my sandwich was a touch over baked, but still delicious. I also enjoy their pizza. It's a good quality, basic pizza, and the individual size is perfect for lunch.

data.title: Adorable little Italian restaurant
data.text: My family ate lunch today at this adorable restaurant in downtown Fort Wayne. Service was quick and our waitress was very friendly and helpful. The Hugo sandwich was filled with loads of meat and an amazing sauce. The chicken parm had wonderful sauce with just the right amount of cheese on top.

data.title: Great Food and Great  Service
data.text: If you want to experience many different types of meats this is the place to go.  All you can eat from a variety of meats and a food bar.  Servers are great and come to your table often.

data.title: Yum! Yum! Yum!
data.text: Anything you get in this restaurant is delicious. Their pizza is to die for; I would recommend trying it! This is a little, family owned restaurant that definitely has an inviting and pleasant atmosphere. Their pasta and salads are wonderful. My favorite thing on the menu is their garlic cheese bread; it is a MUST!

data.title: Place smells like cleaning chemical
data.text: Service is always slow and left more to be desired, especially when you find hair in the food; food generally is okay, not super.  The place stinks, I feel like eating in a bathroom,

data.title: Gross warning...
data.text: Birthday dinner run down: Was super busy so I said I would just take dinner to go...started eating it (veggie roll)...and then...Found a hair. I'm not easily grossed out, so I was like okay it's one hair....until I pulled it out...huge wad of hair. They also put pepperoni on the veggie pizza. I contacted them on Facebook and got a response that "it would be taken care of". I later got a message that they would provide me with a gift card for one dinner. I went in and said I appreciate the offer, but don't know if I want to eat there again and asked for my card to be refunded. "No way" I said fine and walked out.

data.title: Lunch special
data.text: Very good Chicken Manicotti in a nice Alfredo sauce, breadstick and salad - $8.49 before tax.  Ice tea, a little high at $2.49.  Food was a bit slow coming out for lunchtime

data.title: great downtown option
data.text: We had a party of five on a Thursday evening and were seated immediately. The service and food were fantastic. Everyone had pasta, some had the special features, the sausage cannelloni being a favourite. Soups and salads were prompt and tasty, the breadsticks are addictive. Dinners were hot and saucy and cheesy.  We were too full for dessert, but had coffee they especially brewed for us. The only possible take-away for me was that my red wine (actually a decent label) was served almost warm. The prices offer a great value for the quality and portions. Definitely recommend and will definitely return.

data.title: Small Italian restaurant - delicious!
data.text: Great find in downtown Fort Wayne!  We made reservations for a Saturday night and there aren't a lot of larger tables for bigger groups so it worked perfectly!  The food was good, a couple of people had the dessert and it was delicious!  Quite a large menu with pastas, pizzas and sausage rolls.  They also serve beer and wine.  We'll be eating here again soon!

data.title: Oh my goodness the pizza and cheesy garlic bread!
data.text: Yummy yummy yummy!  The individual pizza for lunch is delicious and pair that with their cheesy garlic bread and you are set for the afternoon!

data.title: Excellent pizza !
data.text: My wife and I had a late lunch at Toscani pizzeria, we found our pizza to be fantastic , hearty fresh toppings plenty of cheese. Our waitress Sarah was very friendly and pleasant. We may have found our newest favorite pizza parlor.

data.title: Great Pizza, Warm Atmosphere
data.text:
I don't know what it is about the place but it always feels very cozy!  We love eating outside when the weather is warm (caveat: you may get a visit from one of the colorful creatures that inhabit downtown Fort Wayne.  Otherwise it's very peaceful.)

We almost always get the same thing which is the hand pinched sausage pizza.  As for thin crust, I think it is the best in town!!  The crust is thin and crisp without being too crunchy or crumbly.  The sauce is on the sweet side which I definitely prefer over the bitter sauce that fast-food pizza places use.  

The house red wine is very good and makes the pizza taste even better.  Especially after the second glass.  We usually have the same woman wait on us each time we go and she is warm, friendly, and attentive to the diner's needs even though she seems to be the only wait staff there. 

There is usually a pizza and garlic bread special:  look on the board on the right wall as you walk in.  Very reasonable and high quality food.  A gem in Fort Wayne!

data.title: Delicious Italian!
data.text: Stopped in late for dinner. It was delicious! I recommend the manicotti and breadsticks. Waitress was very nice and friendly!!

data.title: Nice Italian Restaurant
data.text: We had dinner here. The Florentine Ravoli was good as well as the brushetta. Quick service. Good selection of food.

data.title: Good food
data.text: The service was good. The food was tasty. It was a nice environment to have conversation over lunch. I would eat again if given the chance.
